comment: Apparently people should be forced to be attracted to people they're not attracted to. What's next? People shouldn't be allowed to discriminate based on gender?
amr:
# ::snt Apparently people should be forced to be attracted to people they're not attracted to. What's next? People shouldn't be allowed to discriminate based on gender?
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (r / recommend-01
            :ARG1 (f / force-01
                  :ARG1 (p / person)
                  :ARG2 (a / attract-01
                        :ARG0 p
                        :ARG1 (p2 / person
                              :ARG2-of (a2 / attract-01
                                    :polarity -
                                    :ARG1 p))))
            :ARG1-of (a3 / appear-02))
      :snt2 (a4 / amr-unknown
            :mod (n / next))
      :snt3 (r2 / recommend-01
            :ARG1 (a5 / allow-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (d / discriminate-02
                        :ARG0 (p3 / person)
                        :ARG1-of (b / base-02
                              :ARG2 (g / gender))))))

comment: It is okay to not be attracted to trans people, but it isn't okay to insult them based on their gender status.
amr:
# ::snt It is okay to not be attracted to trans people, but it isn't okay to insult them based on their gender status.
(c / contrast-01
      :ARG1 (o / okay-04
            :ARG1 (a / attract-01
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (p / person
                        :mod (t / trans))))
      :ARG2 (o2 / okay-04
            :polarity -
            :ARG1 (ii / insult-01
                  :ARG1 p
                  :ARG1-of (b / base-02
                        :ARG2 (s / status
                              :mod (g / gender)
                              :poss p)))))

comment: Which I disagree with. Nobody should be forced into liking another person. But I wouldn't use those words to prove my point either.
